title: Here’s a Look at Everything (and Everyone) Trump Assailed at Davos
summary: President Trump’s verbal broadsides drew gasps and nervous laughter at the annual gathering of political and business leaders.

title: What’s a Human Life Worth? The E.P.A. Says Zero Dollars.
summary: The Environmental Protection Agency has stopped estimating the dollar value of lives saved in the cost-benefit analyses for new pollution rules.

title: Investigations and a Billion-Dollar ‘Shakedown’: How Trump Targeted Higher Education
summary: Donald J. Trump has unleashed the power of the presidency against American colleges, with mixed results.

title: Halligan Leaves as U.S. Attorney After Mounting Pressure From Judges
summary: For weeks, judges have pressed Ms. Halligan to explain why she continues to identify herself in court filings as the U.S. attorney, despite a ruling in November that she was unlawfully appointed to the job.

title: Court Denies Lawmakers Seeking Independent Monitor of Epstein Files
summary: A federal judge said he did not have the authority to supervise the Justice Department’s release of the documents.

title: Widespread Winter Storm Is Forecast to Bring Heavy Snow to Central and Eastern US
summary: People across a large section of the central and eastern United States are facing predictions of heavy snow and ice starting Friday.

title: Trump Administration Starts Immigration Operation in Maine
summary: A similar operation that unfolded in Minnesota became a flashpoint between protesters and immigration authorities.

title: Cubans in Florida Are Being Deported in Record Numbers
summary: Cubans had long benefited from legal privileges unavailable to immigrants from other countries. President Trump has changed that.

title: New York’s Odd Couple: The Mayor and the Police Commissioner
summary: Zohran Mamdani and Jessica Tisch have little in common. But both of their political futures hinge on the safety of the city.

title: Majority of Latin Americans Endorsed Trump’s Intervention In Venezuela, Polls Show
summary: Several surveys show that a majority of Latin Americans who were questioned endorsed the intervention, suggesting a shift, at least for now, from ideology to pragmatism.

title: After Maduro’s Last Dance, a New Rhythm Goes Viral in Venezuela
summary: For years, Nicolás Maduro and his movement used song and dance to rally support. Now, millions of Venezuelans are dancing to a different political tune.

title: Uber Faces Growing Pressure Over Sexual Assault Record
summary: From the ballot box in California to the halls of Congress and Wall Street, several new initiatives would require more oversight of how the company protects its passengers.

title: How ‘Wine Moms’ Became an Insult for Anti-ICE Protesters
summary: The insult wielded against protesters taps into a long tradition of casting wine drinkers as out-of-touch elitists.

title: What ‘Marty Supreme’ Says About Being Jewish in America
summary: The film’s unapologetic depiction of the experience in all of its complications rejects the idea that such characters have to suffer.

title: What to Know About Brooklyn Beckham’s Accusations Against His Parents
summary: On Monday, the eldest Beckham son posted one-sided explosive accusations against his parents on Instagram. His parents have not responded directly.

title: Europe Has a Bazooka. Time to Use It.
summary: For now, Europe’s anti-coercion instrument is less a bazooka than a waterlogged firecracker.

title: Trump’s ‘Dear Jonas’ Letter Is No Prize
summary: We have three years left with a mad king. It doesn’t feel sustainable.

title: Trump 2.0
summary: We look at the first year of the president’s second term.

title: Mississippi Temple Says There Is More to Its Story Than Facing Hate
summary: An arson attack at a synagogue in Mississippi was a reminder of the threat Jews face, but also of the strength of a small community forged over generations.

title: An Anxious Japan Restarts the World’s Biggest Nuclear Plant
summary: Japan is reviving nuclear power, balancing the need for more clean energy against the lingering trauma of the 2011 Fukushima Daiichi disaster.

title: Michele Tafoya Announces Senate Run in Minnesota
summary: Ms. Tafoya, once a sideline reporter for N.F.L. games, has more recently turned her focus to Republican politics. She is seeking an open seat now held by a Democrat.

title: Prince Harry Gives Emotional Testimony About Effects of News Coverage
summary: Harry said in court that reading articles about him published by Associated Newspapers, which he has accused of acting unlawfully, had been “traumatic.”
